title: iOS Utvecklare
description:
**Om** **Doktor.se**


På Doktor.se omdefinierar vi det svenska sjukvårdssystemet genom att göra det mer tillgängligt, smidigt och effektivt – utan att kompromissa med kvalitet eller säkerhet. Vår unika hybridmodell, som kombinerar fysiska vårdcentraler med moderna digitala lösningar, har gjort oss till den största digitala vårdgivaren i Sverige, med miljontals konsultationer varje år. Vi är också stolta över att vara en av de mest populära arbetsgivarna inom vården.

 **Om rollen**


Som iOS-utvecklare på Doktor.se spelar du en nyckelroll i att skapa teknik som förbättrar människors liv genom att förenkla deras tillgång till vård.


Våra team tar stort ägarskap över helhetsupplevelsen och våra mål – från idé till lansering – kommer du att arbeta nära produktchefer, designers och andra utvecklare för att skapa innovativa lösningar som förbättrar vårdupplevelsen för miljontals användare.

 **Vad du kommer jobba med**

* Utveckla nya funktioner från idé till lansering i nära samarbete med ditt team.
* Bygga användarcentrerade gränssnitt i SwiftUI, UIKit och AutoLayout.
* Ansvara för att publicera i AppStore och kontinuerligt förbättra våra appar.
* Bidra till teamets utveckling genom att dela kunskap och samarbeta tvärfunktionellt.

  

**Vad du bidrar med**

* Du ska gärna ha 5 år eller mer erfarenhet av iOS-utveckling med gedigen förståelse av framförallt Swift men även Objective-C samt iOS SDKer.
* Erfarenhet av test-driven utveckling (TDD) och skriva enhets- och UI-tester.
* Kunskap om iOS arkitektur och design patterns som MVVM, Combine och Clean Architecture.
* Kunna bygga gränssnitt med hjälp av SwiftUI, UIKit och AutoLayout.
* Erfarenhet av modulär utveckling för att hantera komplexa kodbaser.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med backend APIer som REST.
  
* 

  

**Vem vi söker**

* **Fokus på användarna:** Du har ett öga för detaljer och är van att balansera tekniska krav med användarens behov.
* **Senioritet:** Du har erfarenhet av att driva på utvecklingsarbetet, inte rädd för att komma med förslag på hur vi arbetar eller på projekten, och kanske har vart med i rekryteringsprocesser tidigare.
* **Nyfikenhet och utveckling:** Du är angelägen om att ständigt lära dig och utvecklas, både personligen och som en del av ett team, och du tycker om att hjälpa andra att göra detsamma.
* **Ägandeskap**: Du har en stark laganda och tar stort ansvar både för produkten och teamet, och du är van att arbeta i snabba, agila miljöer.
* **Du brinner för teknik som gör skillnad** och vill använda teknik för att lösa riktiga problem och förenkla människors vardag.
* **Språk:** Vi kommunicerar huvudsakligen på engelska inom Tech-avdelningen, men förmågan att kommunicera på svenska med personer utanför Tech är en stor fördel.

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**

* **Anställningsform**: Tillsvidareanställning med inledande provanställning.
* **Förmåner**: 30 dagars semester, ITP1-pension, friskvårdsbidrag och personligt utbildningsbidrag.
* **Hybrid/Flexibilitet**: Vi jobbar på kontoret fyra dagar i veckan, valfritt hemifrån på fredagar eller vid behov.
* **Arbetsmiljö**: Ett samarbetsinriktat team och ett modernt kontor på Sveavägen 63 i Stockholm.
* **Personlig utveckling:** Möjligheter att arbeta på meningsfulla projekt som påverkar miljontals människor. Med fokus på din personliga och professionella utveckling stödjer vi dig via coaching och möjlighet att vidareutbilda dig.

 **Ansökningsprocess**

* **Startdatum:** Så snart som möjligt, med hänsyn till uppsägningstid.
* **Urval:** Rekryteringsprocessen är pågående, och om din profil stämmer överens med våra behov, kommer vi att kontakta dig omgående.
* **Bakgrundskontroll:** Innan anställning kräver vi ett utdrag ur belastningsregistret och ID/passkontroll.
* **Sekretess:** På grund av GDPR accepterar vi inte e-postansökningar.
* **Visum/flytt -sponsring:** För denna roll krävs att kandidaten redan har arbetstillstånd och bor i Sverige.
* **Byråer/Konsulter:** Vi avböjer vänligen alla rekryteringsförfrågningar från byråer och konsulter samt jobbsajter.

**Var med och revolutionera vården!**


Med miljontals registrerade användare och stark tillväxt år efter år leder Doktor.se tillsammans med våra varumärken Doktor24 och Kollarna vägen inom digital och fysisk vård.


Kom och hjälp oss förbättra vårdupplevelsen i Sverige!
company_description: På Doktor.Se vill vi göra saker annorlunda. Vi vill utmana och förändra en hel bransch.

title: Developer - Business Platform
description:
*Vi tror på ett samhälle format av framgångsrika företag där entreprenörskap och samhällsnytta går hand i hand. Att vara en del av Fortnox är att vara en del av en ständig förändring - en förändring där du själv bestämmer hur långt du vill nå. Vårt största fokus är att ge dig rätt förutsättningar att få leva din passion tillsammans med oss. Var du kommer ifrån är inte relevant - det är vart du är på väg som är intressant för oss. Precis som vi igår inte kunde drömma om det Fortnox som finns idag, så kan du vara med och forma vilka vi är imorgon.*

 **Om tjänsten**


I vårt affärsområde Business Platform utvecklar vi Fortnox centrala SaaS-produkter – kärnan i Fortnox erbjudande. Här skapar vi smarta, skalbara och användarvänliga lösningar som dagligen används av hundratusentals företagare i Sverige. Vårt ansvar sträcker sig över produktområden som redovisning, fakturering, medarbetare och rapportering – allt det som utgör grunden för företagares vardag. Samtidigt jobbar vi tätt ihop med våra kollegor inom Financial Services för att tillsammans erbjuda en sömlös helhetslösning, där kärnprodukterna möter smarta tilläggstjänster inom t.ex. betalningar och finansiering.


Som utvecklare På Business Platform får du vara med och utveckla produkter som spelar en avgörande roll i Fortnox plattform och där varje förbättring får stor effekt för våra kunder. Som utvecklare hos oss blir du en del av ett autonomt team med helhetsansvar för sina produkter – från idé till produktion. Vi jobbar agilt och produktnära, med stort fokus på teknik, innovation och kundnytta. Du kommer att ha möjlighet att arbeta både frontend och backend och att bidra till tekniska beslut, arkitektur och metodutveckling.

**Vår Tech-stack (varierar mellan team)**

  

* Backend: Java, Kotlin, Go, PHP, Node.js
* Frontend: Backbone.js/JavaScript, React/React Native/TypeScript, Databaser & integrationslager: PostgreSQL, REST, Kafka
* DevOps: Docker, Kubernetes, GitHub, Bitbucke
  

**Vi tror att du*** Har flera års erfarenhet av professionell mjukvaruutveckling
* Har goda kunskaper inom Java/Kotlin/PHP och gärna även React eller annan modern frontend-teknik
* Har erfarenhet av agila team och produktutveckling
* Trivs i en föränderlig miljö där du får bidra med din kompetens, nyfikenhet och kreativitet
* Kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska

**Våra orter*** **Växjö** – Fortnox huvudkontor! Här utvecklar vi flera av våra centrala core-produkter och huserar majoriteten av Business Platforms 27 utvecklingsteam.
* **Stockholm** – På Linnégatan 89 skapar vi morgondagens digitala verktyg! Här utvecklar vi vår nya AI-plattform och effektiva lösningar för styrelseportal, koncern, dokument- och ärendehantering.
* **Linköping** - ett av våra mindre kontor som präglas av sammansvetsade team och stark gemenskap. Här utvecklar vi företagsbrevlådan och våra värdefulla rapport- och analysprodukter, vilka är centrala för våra kunders framgång.


Vi arbetar hybrid: 3 dagar på kontoret och 2 dagar hemifrån. Vi uppmuntrar teamen att själva organisera sitt arbetssätt.

**Varför Fortnox?**

  

* En plats i ett av Sveriges mest snabbväxande techbolag
  
* Möjlighet att påverka teknik, arkitektur och produktutveckling
  
* Kollegor som delar din passion för kod, kundvärde och ständig förbättring
  
* En kultur där lärande, delaktighet och samarbete står i centrum
  
* Flexibla arbetssätt som fungerar i livet – inte bara på jobbet

**Om Fortnox**  

*Fortnox AB (publ) är en företagsplattform som knyter samman människor, företag och organisationer. Vi hjälper företag starta, växa och utvecklas. Med smarta tekniska produkter, lösningar och tjänster, och möjlighet att koppla ihop dem med hundratals externa parter, är vi ett nav för företagande i Sverige. Vår vision är att skapa ett välmående samhälle format av framgångsrika företag. Fortnox grundades 2001 och har huvudkontor i Växjö samt kontor i Malmö, Linköping och Stockholm. Aktien är noterad på Nasdaq Stockholm. För ytterligare information se* *www.fortnox.se**.*

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**

title: Developer - Business Support
description:
*Vi tror på ett samhälle format av framgångsrika företag där entreprenörskap och samhällsnytta går hand i hand. Att vara en del av Fortnox är att vara en del av en ständig förändring - en förändring där du själv bestämmer hur långt du vill nå. Vårt största fokus är att ge dig rätt förutsättningar att få leva din passion tillsammans med oss. Var du kommer ifrån är inte relevant - det är vart du är på väg som är intressant för oss. Precis som vi igår inte kunde drömma om det Fortnox som finns idag, så kan du vara med och forma vilka vi är imorgon.*

 **Om tjänsten**


I affärsområdet Business Support bygger vi den tekniska infrastrukturen som hela Fortnox utvecklingsorganisation vilar på. Här skapar vi verktyg, plattformar och stödsystem som gör det möjligt för våra utvecklingsteam att arbeta effektivt, säkert och med hög kvalitet varje dag. Vi ansvarar också för Fortnox externa webbplats och våra mobila lösningar.


Hos oss får du arbeta med produkter som kanske inte alltid syns utåt, men som är avgörande för att hela Fortnox maskineri ska fungera – från CI/CD till identitetshantering och mobilanvändning. Just nu söker vi utvecklare till Business Support inom flera olika områden och alla med målet att ge våra utvecklingsteam bästa möjliga förutsättningar att bygga produkter i världsklass.


Här är några exempel på vad du kan arbeta med:

**Identity & Access Management (IAM)**

  

Bygg framtidens identitetsplattform! Du blir en nyckelperson i vårt team som ansvarar för autentisering, auktorisering och kontohantering. Vi arbetar med moderna protokoll (OAuth2, OIDC, SAML) och utvecklar API:er och SDK:er för att säkerställa säker åtkomst, både för interna och externa användare.

**Intern utvecklarplattform (Accelerate)**

  

Här bygger vi vår interna plattform som gör det möjligt för Fortnox utvecklare att ta sig från kod till produktion snabbare och enklare. Vi jobbar med självservice, automatisering, standardisering och portalutveckling (Backstage) för att skapa en utvecklarupplevelse i världsklass.

**Mobil plattform (App)**

  

Vill du jobba nära produkten? Här fokuserar vi på Fortnox mobilapp, både gemensamma komponenter, interna ramverk och tekniska stöd för andra team. Du får jobba med React Native, TypeScript och moderna plattformsverktyg för att förbättra användarupplevelsen för våra appanvändare.

**Vår Tech-stack (varierar mellan team)**

  

* **Backend:** Java, Go, Kotlin, Node.js
* **Frontend & mobil:** React, TypeScript, React Native, Swift, Kotlin
* **Identitet & säkerhet:** OAuth2, OpenID Connect, SAML
* **Plattform:** Kubernetes, Docker, Backstage, GitHub Actions, observability (Prometheus, Grafana)

**Vi tror att du*** Har flera års erfarenhet av professionell mjukvaruutveckling
* Har erfarenhet inom något eller flera av områdena: plattformsutveckling, identitetshantering, mobilutveckling, infrastruktur
* Gillar att arbeta nära andra utvecklare och underlätta för dem att lyckas
* Har förståelse för moderna molnplattformar, CI/CD och säkerhetsprinciper
* Kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska

**Våra orter**  

Vi finns framförallt i **Växjö** och **Linköping** där vi arbetar hybrid: 3 dagar på kontoret och 2 dagar hemifrån. Teamen organiserar sitt arbetssätt tillsammans. För vissa roller erbjuder vi arbete från andra orter och i vissa fall helt på distans.


**Varför Fortnox?**

* En kultur där lärande och utveckling står i centrum
* Möjlighet att göra skillnad för Sveriges företagare – och dina kollegor
* Flexibla arbetssätt och en hybridmodell som fungerar i vardagen
* Kollegor som bryr sig – om produkten, om användarna och om varandra.

**Om Fortnox**  

*Fortnox AB (publ) är en företagsplattform som knyter samman människor, företag och organisationer. Vi hjälper företag starta, växa och utvecklas. Med smarta tekniska produkter, lösningar och tjänster, och möjlighet att koppla ihop dem med hundratals externa parter, är vi ett nav för företagande i Sverige. Vår vision är att skapa ett välmående samhälle format av framgångsrika företag. Fortnox grundades 2001 och har huvudkontor i Växjö samt kontor i Malmö, Linköping och Stockholm. Aktien är noterad på Nasdaq Stockholm. För ytterligare information se* *www.fortnox.se**.*

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**

title: Developer - Financial Services
description:
*Vi tror på ett samhälle format av framgångsrika företag där entreprenörskap och samhällsnytta går hand i hand. Att vara en del av Fortnox är att vara en del av en ständig förändring - en förändring där du själv bestämmer hur långt du vill nå. Vårt största fokus är att ge dig rätt förutsättningar att få leva din passion tillsammans med oss. Var du kommer ifrån är inte relevant - det är vart du är på väg som är intressant för oss. Precis som vi igår inte kunde drömma om det Fortnox som finns idag, så kan du vara med och forma vilka vi är imorgon.*

 **Om tjänsten**


På Fortnox Financial Services utvecklar vi innovativa lösningar som hjälper Sveriges företagare att få betalt för sina tjänster och hantera sin finansiering. Vi bygger finansiella produkter som fungerar sömlöst med Fortnox core-produkter och vårt uppdrag är att komplettera och förstärka Business Platforms erbjudande med värdeskapande fintech-lösningar som gör livet enklare för Sveriges företagare. Vi är alltså den finansiella motorn i plattformen och en växande satsning inom Fortnox.


Vi söker nu utvecklare som vill ta nästa steg tillsammans med oss och forma framtidens FinTech lösning på Fortnox – i Malmö, Växjö, Linköping och Stockholm. Som utvecklare hos oss blir du en nyckelspelare i ett tvärfunktionellt team med helhetsansvar för utvecklingen - från idé till lansering. Vi arbetar agilt, produktnära och med stort fokus på kundvärde. Som utvecklare får du möjlighet att arbeta genom hela teknikstacken och påverka såväl tekniska val som metoder och leverans. Vi jobbar enligt Product Operating Model - ett nära samarbete mellan utvecklare, produktchefer och designers, där vi bygger skalbara och användarvänliga FinTech-tjänster. Du blir del av en kultur som präglas av innovation, nyfikenhet, kunskapsdelning och ständig utveckling.

**Vi arbetar med**

  

* **Frontend**: JavaScript/TypeScript, React
  
* **Backend**: Java, Kotlin, Go
  
* **Integrationer och data**: REST-API:er, SQL-databaser, Kafka
  
* **Övrigt**: Microservices, AI/Machine Learning, GitHub/Bitbucket
  

**Om dig**  

  

Du är en erfaren utvecklare med ett genuint teknikintresse, som trivs i en föränderlig miljö där nya idéer välkomnas och omsätts i praktiken. Du är självgående, lösningsorienterad och delar gärna med dig av din kunskap till andra.  

Vi ser gärna att du har:

* Flera års erfarenhet av professionell mjukvaruutveckling.
  
* Stark kompetens inom backend (Java, Kotlin, Go) och gärna även frontend (React, TypeScript).
  
* Kunskap och intresse för ML/Algoritmer.
  
* Erfarenhet av agila arbetssätt och produktnära utveckling.
  
* God kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och engelska.

**Våra orter**  

Oavsett var du utgår ifrån kommer du att tillhöra ett team med stort ansvar och starkt driv. Vi tillämpar en **hybridmodell** med 3 dagar på kontoret och 2 dagar hemifrån. Varje team har stort inflytande över hur det organiserar sig.* **Stockholm** – på Linnégatan 89 hittar du en komplett fin-tech hubb! Här finns en bredd av kompetenser och du blir del av ett tvärfunktionellt team som tillsammans positionerar Fortnox som Sveriges mest spännande fin-tech bolag!
  
* **Växjö** – Fortnox huvudkontor och vår största hubb för utveckling!
  
* **Malmö** – Centralt kontor på Drottninggatan 34, här är nya utvecklingsteam under uppbyggnad så du får vara med på något nytt i tidigt skede!
  
* **Linköping** – Här bygger vi något helt nytt: algoritmer, ML och nästa generations finansiella system!
  

**Varför Fortnox?**  

Vi erbjuder inte bara en plats i ett av Sveriges mest spännande FinTech-bolag – vi erbjuder även:

* En kultur där lärande och utveckling står i centrum.
  
* En plats i ett av Sveriges mest snabbväxande företag.
  
* Möjlighet att göra skillnad, för Sveriges företagare och samhället i stort.
  
* Flexibla arbetssätt och en hybridmodell som fungerar i vardagen.
  
* Kollegor som bryr sig – om produkten, om våra användare och om varandra.

**Om Fortnox**  

*Fortnox AB (publ) är en företagsplattform som knyter samman människor, företag och organisationer. Vi hjälper företag starta, växa och utvecklas. Med smarta tekniska produkter, lösningar och tjänster, och möjlighet att koppla ihop dem med hundratals externa parter, är vi ett nav för företagande i Sverige. Vår vision är att skapa ett välmående samhälle format av framgångsrika företag. Fortnox grundades 2001 och har huvudkontor i Växjö samt kontor i Malmö, Linköping och Stockholm. Aktien är noterad på Nasdaq Stockholm. För ytterligare information se* *www.fortnox.se**.*

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**

title: Senior Software Engineer (.Net)
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 As a
 **Senior Software Engineer** 
 , you will provide technical leadership and strategic direction to your development team. Your role involves overseeing the entire software development lifecycle, from conceptualization and design to development, testing, and maintenance. You will lead the design of complex systems and applications, including 3D/2D render pipelines, while guiding and mentoring other engineers. Your broad and deep understanding of various technologies will ensure the delivery of high-quality software that meets user and stakeholder expectations.
   

  

**In addition to the above, your role will involve:** 
  

  

* Software Development & Optimization: Design, develop, and optimize high-quality, secure, scalable, and reliable software that meets business and customer needs.
* Technical Leadership & Mentorship: Provide technical leadership and direction to teams, mentoring engineers to foster a collaborative environment and achieve business goals.
* Stakeholder Collaboration & Problem Solving: Engage with stakeholders to understand complex requirements and propose innovative solutions to enhance system architecture and performance.
* Project Scoping & Risk Management: Lead work estimates and forecasts, identifying risks, challenges, and opportunities with technical expertise.
* Standards & Code Reviews: Adhere to and improve architecture, design, implementation, and security standards, conduct code reviews and promoting collaborative programming.
* System Integration & Testing: Analyse integration needs, design complex system integrations, and implement unit and integration tests to ensure software quality.
* Reusable Components & Documentation: Develop and maintain reusable software components and frameworks, defining and maintaining standards for technical documentation.
* Communication & Continuous Improvement: Convey complex technical concepts to stakeholders and continuously enhance development practices and processes for better efficiency and quality.


**Who You’ll Work With**
 As a Senior Software Engineer, you’ll collaborate closely with a cross-functional team that includes the Product Manager, Solution Architect, fellow developers, and application experts. You won’t just contribute code—you’ll help shape the technical direction, mentor team members, and drive the delivery of high-quality solutions. Your leadership will play a key role in turning ideas into scalable, maintainable, and impactful software.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We are looking for people with...
   

  

* Experience: Minimum 5+ years of hands-on experience in application development and system integration. NET Core, Microservices, and APIs are must have with strong hands-on skills.
* Azure Cloud Services: Strong hands-on experience with Azure Functions, Azure Logic Apps, Azure Service Bus, Azure App Service, Azure App Insights, Blob Storage, Azure Monitoring, and Azure Cosmos DB.
* CI/CD Pipelines: Experience in creating and working with CI/CD pipelines using Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions, and Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using Bicep, Terraform, etc.
* Messaging Frameworks and Event Brokers: Exposure to Solace PubSub, Kafka, etc.
* Integration Projects: Experience in building cloud-native integrations.
* Application and Cloud Security: Good knowledge of best practices.
* Artifact Preparation: Ability to prepare well-designed artifacts.
* Technical Improvements: Ability to suggest technical improvements.


 And people who are…
   

  

* Problem-Solver: Exceptional at identifying and resolving issues with a keen eye for detail.
* Collaborator: Highly collaborative and proactive in seeking clarification and asking questions.
* Effective Communicator: Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Self-Driven: Motivated and capable of working independently.
* Responsible: Takes ownership of tasks, works proactively, and continuously seeks improvement.


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE** 
  

  

 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

* Staff discount card: Usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online.
* H&M Incentive Program (HIP): Included in our HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
* Competitive pensions: Collective Agreement and ITP pensions competitive to the Swedish market.
* Generous vacation: 30 days' vacation, health care allowance, and good work-life balance.
* Additional perks: Discounts from Benify.
* Innovative Environment: Work with cutting-edge technology and innovative solutions.
* Global Impact: Be part of a team that influences users worldwide.
* Professional Growth: Endless opportunities to learn and develop your skills.
* Collaborative Culture: Join a motivated team that values collaboration and excellence.


**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

**Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.**

title: Backend Developer  Intern
company_industry: Software Development, IT System Custom Software Development, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**XR Solutions** 
 is a technology based company that utilizes machine learning and powerful research-based optimizations to provide practical, reliable and optimizing augmented reality solutions to industrial companies.
 



 We believe that our AR technology can change working methods, the way of thinking and enable new innovative solutions that previously was not achievable in industry and machine operation.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 We are seeking a passionate and dedicated
 **Backend Developer Intern** 
 to join our team for a 6-month unpaid internship. This is an exciting opportunity for someone looking to gain hands-on experience in backend development and DevOps within a fast-paced and supportive environment. As a
 **Backend Developer Intern** 
 at
 **XR Solutions** 
 , you will work closely with our developers.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* **Implementing APIs** 
 : Develop and maintain effective and performant APIs using
 **Node.js** 
 and
 **Express.js** 
 to support various applications and services.
* **System Integrations** 
 : Assist in the design and implementation of system integrations, ensuring seamless communication between different software components.
* **Testing** 
 : Build and execute unit integration tests to ensure the reliability and efficiency of our systems.
* **DevOps** 
 - Working with
 **AWS** 
 and setting up a well preferment software architecture
* **Maintenance** 
 : Participate in the troubleshooting,
 **debugging** 
 , and
 **patching** 
 of existing software to maintain optimal performance and resolve issues promptly.
* **Software Quality** 
 : Improve software quality by adhering to industry best practices.
* **Code Reviews** 
 : Engage in code review sessions with other developers to ensure code quality, consistency, and adherence to best practices.
* **IT Security** 
 : Contribute to maintaining and enhancing IT security protocols, ensuring that all systems are secure and compliant with industry standards.



  





**Required Skills:** 



* Proficiency in
 **Node.js** 
 and
 **Express.js** 
 for backend development.
* Strong knowledge of
 **JavaScript** 
 and
 **TypeScript.**
* Experience with

title: STEP Developer
description:
**Shape the Future of Master Data at Nobia**
 We are looking for an
 **MDM STEP Developer** 
 who is passionate about building structured, high-quality data solutions that empower better customer experiences and smarter business decisions. At Nobia, Europe's leading kitchen specialist, we’re on an exciting transformation journey—and data is at the heart of it.
   

  

 This role plays a key part in supporting and developing our Master Data Management (MDM) solutions, focusing on
 **STEP** 
 as our core MDM platform. You will contribute to harmonized business processes and a global SAP template that supports our "One Company" agenda—enabling smarter operations across Europe.
   

  

**As an MDM STEP Developer, you will:**
* Support the build and roll out of STEP as Nobia’s primary MDM system
* Design solutions aligned with our application development road map to ensure security, scalability, and fit-for-purpose systems
* Develop STEP configurations and enhancements based on business requirements using core application components and clean, concise code
* Collaborate with the Lead Architect to shape the future of our product data platform, including PIM and DAM
* Design and maintain product data interfaces, data models, data upload processes, and maintenance workflows
* Understand and document data flows from source to consumer systems
* Ensure data cleaning, validation, and integrity to maintain high-quality data
* Work closely with analytics and business stakeholders to identify needs and prioritize development
* Be an advocate for strong data foundations within the organization


**We’re looking for someone who:**
* Brings strong technical skills in Java or JavaScript, XML, and JSON
* Understands data integration with downstream systems and is detail-oriented about information design
* Has experience with data profiling, data mapping, and quality rules development in STEP
* Is fluent in English


**Why Nobia?**
 At Nobia, we don’t just build kitchens—we build sustainable solutions that improve lives. You’ll be part of a purpose-driven company where people matter, ideas grow, and potential is realized.
   

  

 We offer:
   

  

* A collaborative and forward-thinking environment
* Opportunities for learning and development


 We hire for attitude and train for skills. If you're ready to be part of something meaningful, we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

**Apply Now**
 Ready to join a company that’s shaping the future of kitchen living through data? Apply today and become part of Nobia’s data-driven journey.
 **Last day to apply is August 3, 2025.**

title: Full-stack developer
description:
At Cevoid, we believe a brand's success is rooted in its customers' engagement. Behind every brand lies a vibrant and passionate community eager to engage, share, and champion their favorite products and experiences. Our mission is to provide e-commerce brands with the tools they need to unlock their communities' potential, and now we’re looking for a thoughtful, creative, and highly
 **driven Full-Stack Developer** 
 to join us on that journey.
 



  




 About Us
 * We're a small, dynamic team based in central Stockholm.
* We build tools that power real impact for e-commerce brands.
* Our current tech team has 3 full-stack and 1 designer; you'd be our fifth teammate.
* We're generalists who prioritize clean code, smart UX, and getting things done.
* We move fast, love experimenting, and ship meaningful features weekly.
* We embrace a startup mindset, valuing speed and iteration\*\*.\*\* We focus on getting real results and improving quickly, rather than waiting for things to be absolutely perfect.



  




 What You’ll Do
 * Work across our entire stack, from front-end development to back-end services and infrastructure.
* Design, build, and ship features used by both brands and their customers, with a constant focus on high execution speed and delivering high-quality work.
* Take part in shaping and building new AI-powered features, like smart suggestions, better search using embeddings, and intelligent content automation. Your curiosity and experience with AI tools will be invaluable here.
* Own problems end-to-end: from idea and planning to implementation and iteration. We're looking for someone who doesn’t wait to be told what to do and can drive progress independently.
* Contribute actively to product discussions and help shape the future of Cevoid, always taking pride in delivering significant impact to our product and user experience.



  




 Our Tech Stack
 * **Frontend** 
 : React (Next.js), Styled Components, Zustand
* **Backend** 
 : Node.js (TypeScript), MongoDB, Redis, GraphQL
* **Infra** 
 : Google Cloud Platform
* **Tools** 
 : GitHub, Linear, Notion, Slack


- 

 What We’re Looking For in a Developer
 
 We're looking for a developer with a
 **minimum of 4 years of professional full-stack experience** 
 who can hit the ground running.
 



 You’ll thrive if:
 


* You take ownership of tasks, ask questions early, and drive progress independently. You can take a feature from idea to implementation without needing hand-holding.
* You can deliver high-quality work fast, especially on well-scoped tasks, with a strong sense of momentum and urgency.
* You keep the team updated proactively (via Linear, Slack, and check-ins), flag blockers early, and are clear about your progress. You are collaborative and responsive, engaging with feedback, making it easy to work with you.
* You've built full-stack applications before (professionally or independently) and are proficient in JavaScript/TypeScript and React.
* You care about UX and sweat the small stuff, understanding that the details make a difference for the end-user.
* You're curious about AI and already use AI tools (like Cursor, ChatGPT, or Claude Code) to boost your productivity or solve problems in your workflow. We believe in leveraging these technologies to move faster and smarter.



  





 🛑
 **This isn’t a junior role.** 
 We’re a small team, and we need someone who can run with things independently and contribute meaningfully from day one.
 



  





 This probably
 *isn’t* 
 the right role if:
 


* You’re still learning the basics of JavaScript/TypeScript or React.
* You’ve never shipped a full-stack project from start to finish.
* You prefer lots of structure and step-by-step direction.



  




 Where you’ll work
 
 Our office is in central Stockholm, and we love working together in person, it’s where the best ideas and quickest problem-solving happen.
 



 That said, we’re flexible when life demands it: remote work is totally fine when needed, and you’ll always be trusted to manage your own time.
 



  




**How applying works** 

 We want this to be a two-way conversation. Here's how it works:
 


1. **Short application** 
 – Just a quick form to get to know you.
2. **Intro call** 
 – A relaxed, no-pressure chat to learn more about each other.
3. **Take-home assignment** 
 – A short written case study + Loom video to explain your thinking.
4. **Interviews** 
 – Meet the team and go deeper into the technical side.

title: Senior Fullstack Developer (Java/Javascript)
description:
**Välkommen till B3 Innovation – där teknik och trivsel går hand i hand!**
 Välkommen till B3 Innovation, hjärtat av systemutveckling inom B3 Consulting Group! Här kombinerar vi den familjära känslan från ett småföretag med storbolagets resurser.
   

  

 Vi är ett engagerat gäng med konsulter som specialiserar oss på systemutveckling inom Java och moderna JavaScriptramverk. I en miljö där du får möjlighet att växa både professionellt och personligt i en inkluderande gemenskap. Oavsett om du är en passionerad cyklist eller en bokslukare, så finns det plats för dig hos oss.
   

  

**Om rollen som fullstackutvecklare inom Java/** 
 Javascript på B3 Innovation
   

  

 Som Senior fullstackutvecklare hos oss kommer du att:
   

  

* utveckla högkvalitativa och skalbara lösningar
* samarbeta med ett tvärfunktionellt team av experter
* Delta i design och arkitektur av nya system.


**Om dig**
 Vi söker dig som har god erfarenhet och arbetat i fullstackrollen under en längre tid. Du som har hunnit både göra misstag och även lära av dem. Förhoppningsvis tycker du om att arbeta i team, dela med dig av dina kunskaper och vill fortsätta att lära dig nytt.
   

  

 Våra krav för att du ska passa i denna roll:
   

  

* Du behärskar svenska i tal och skrift.
* Du har minst 5 års erfarenhet av utvecklarrollen.
* Du har god kunskap att jobba med Java, Javascript, Kotlin, Spring, Microservices.
* Du har god kunskap att jobba med olika ramverk som React, Angular och Vue.
* Du har erfarenhet av att jobba i agila team.


**Varför B3 Innovation?**
* Innovativ Kultur: Vi uppmuntrar kreativitet och nya idéer.
* Inkluderande miljö: Vi värdesätter mångfald och strävar efter en arbetsplats där alla känner sig välkomna.
* Balans och flexibilitet: Flexibilitet är centralt, vilket gör att du kan forma din arbetsdag för att få livspusslet att gå ihop. Vi förstår vikten av balans mellan arbete och fritid och erbjuder därför flexibla arbetstider.
* Gemenskap: Hos oss blir du en del av ett stöttande team som arbetar tillsammans för att nå gemensamma mål. Det handlar inte bara om “jobb jobb jobb” hos oss. Vi anordnar allt från tech-workshops till sociala aktiviteter som stickcaféer, spelkvällar och AW.


**Om B3 Innovation**
 Vi är kända för vårt fokus på innovation och förmåga att leverera värde till våra kunder. Genom att kombinera djup teknisk expertis med en stark förståelse för våra kunders verksamhet, skapar vi lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad. Vår kultur bygger på öppenhet, samarbete och en passion för teknik.
   

  

 Vi prioriterar personlig utveckling och erbjuder verktyg som B3 Academy, TechTalks och "Lunch & Learn" för att du ska kunna växa.
   

  

 Upptäck möjligheterna med B3 Innovation. Som utvecklare får du arbeta inom spännande branscher som media, bank och finans, energi, offentlig sektor, telekom och e-handel. Oavsett om du optimerar TV-sändningar, utvecklar digitala banktjänster eller skapar smarta hem, hjälper vi dig att hitta det perfekta uppdraget som matchar dina intressen.
   

  

 Våra toppbetyg i medarbetarundersökningar visar att nöjda kollegor är kärnan i vår framgång. Är du redo att kliva in i en miljö där utveckling och trivsel går hand i hand?
   

  

 Som sagt, välkommen till B3 Innovation – vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

**Är du redo att ta nästa steg?**
 Skicka in din ansökan idag och bli en del av vårt engagerade och innovativa team!
   

  

 Om du är mer nyfiken på oss så kan du läsa mer om oss här: https://www.b3.se/innovation
   

  

 Om du har funderingar så hör gärna av dig till Kenneth Andersson på +46706678050 alt mail kenneth.andersson@b3.se.

title: Senior Fullstack Developer - Node
description:
**At Hemnet, we're in the midst of an exciting transformation — rebalancing our tech stack to better support the future of our products and teams. As part of this journey, we’re starting to expand our tech stack from our existing Ruby-based architecture to modern, scalable services built with Node.js.** 
  

  

 To accelerate this shift and strengthen our capabilities, we’re now investing in growing by hiring additional Node.js developers.
   

  

**What’s in it for you?** 
  

  

* 🧪 Innovative Approach: Work with an experimental and iterative approach. Dare to explore uncharted territories, try something new, and surprise us all!
* 🔄 End-to-End Development: Develop and maintain our products from idea to production
* 🫂 Inclusive Culture: Enjoy a friendly, inclusive, and caring company culture where transparency, work-life balance, and well-being are high priorities. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees, regardless of gender, sexual orientation, ethnicity, or background
* ⚗️ Lab Weeks: Participate in recurring lab weeks—time for our developers to experiment, hack around, and evaluate creative ideas. Unleash Your Inner Mad Scientist—innovation starts here!
* 🛠️ Autonomy: Be part of a team that controls its own product decisions


  

  

**What you will do:** 
  

  

* Contribute to the continuous improvement of existing products and the development of new ones within the product team
* Collaborate closely with designers, product managers, and stakeholders to shape product vision and technical direction
* Participate in discussions and decisions related to architecture, implementation, and prioritization
* Take ownership of code quality, performance, and maintainability through testing, reviews, and refactoring
* Support and maintain production systems, ensuring reliability and stability
* Foster strong cross-functional relationships and actively contribute to a collaborative team culture
* Node.js Journey: Play a central role in our Node.js journey. While we have some services already running in production, this is just the beginning


  

  

**We believe you are:** 
  

  

 We see that you are an experienced developer with documented, commercial experience of working with the Node ecosystem. As our current architecture still includes Ruby components, we think that you are willing to learn and navigate the Ruby code base.
   

  

* Experience from data-driven product development with short iterations and experimentation
* Team Collaboration: Experience working in team settings, especially in medium to large multicultural/global companies
* Extensive experience and proficiency with other programming languages and eco systems. Meritorious frameworks: NestJS, Ruby on Rails, Typescript, React, and Next.js


  

  

**Your technical expertise likely includes several of the following areas:** 
  

  

* JavaScript – Proficiency in ES5, ES6+, and asynchronous programming
* Node.js – In-depth knowledge of Node.js and its ecosystem and frameworks (e.g., NestJS)
* Web Applications – Proven experience in driving architecture and system design, as well as developing and maintaining complex web-based applications in production environments
* RESTful APIs – Experience in designing and implementing RESTful APIs
* GraphQL – Familiarity with best practices for implementing and maintaining GraphQL APIs
* Database Management – Proficiency with relational databases such as PostgreSQL
* Cloud Services – Familiarity with AWS, Docker, and CircleCI, including deployment and scaling of Node.js services in cloud environments
* Testing and Debugging – Skilled in testing and debugging Node.js applications to ensure performance and reliabilit


  

  

**🏡 Your career at Hemnet** 
  

  

 With over 40 million visits each month, you’ll be part of Sweden’s most popular property platform – and one of the world’s most admired real estate platforms. But our size and reputation aren’t the only reasons why you and your 150+ colleagues enjoy working here.
   

  

 Since 1998, Hemnet has been an essential go-to place for millions of Swedes, guiding them through one of life’s biggest transitions: finding a new place to call home. We’re proud to make this life-changing, often stressful journey as seamless as possible.
   

  

 With access to vast amounts of data, you’ll have limitless opportunities to explore and create new features that enhance the experience for Sweden’s real estate agents, home buyers, and sellers.
   

  

 Our friendly Hemnet culture fosters a dynamic, playful environment where every voice is valued. Here, you’ll join a welcoming team that encourages you to thrive and grow, working alongside passionate colleagues from around the world.
   

  

**A Hybrid Way of Working** 
  

  

 Our vibrant office in central Stockholm is the hub of our collaboration and culture, providing a lively space that fosters team spirit. We come together in the office three days a week, with two flexible remote days. To be part of our team, it’s essential to be based in or near Stockholm.

title: Lead Developer to Telenor
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
At Telenor, you own your career. Here, you'll have the opportunity to make the most of your dreams and expertise while contributing to technological innovations that are barely even imagined today. Innovations that we know will change the map for how we communicate and live our connected lives in the future. Are you looking for a workplace where you can make a difference in what matters most - relationships between people.
   

  

 We are looking for a forward-thinking and innovative person to join one of our dynamic development teams. Telenor is rapidly adapting to the digital future, and we are looking for people with a natural proactive drive who want to make a difference.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 As a Lead Developer, you will help shape the technical vision and ensure the quality of software within your team, working primarily with AWS and Java SpringBoot microservices. You will lead the design of robust, scalable, and secure solutions, while mentoring team members in best practices for coding, design, and performance optimization.
   

  

 You will collaborate with stakeholders, architects, and team leaders to support project and development planning. Your role will also involve at least 50% hands-on coding, conducting code reviews, and continuously improving development processes, focusing on maintaining the product's technical health. You'll also be accountable for enhancing developer experience and helping the team balance short- and long-term goals, ensuring delivery of key objectives and adhering to technical guidelines.
   

  

 In addition, you will be part of the
 **Lead Developer chapter** 
 , where you will:
   

  

* Actively drive and participate in improvement projects and ways of working.
* Contribute to coding standards and design patterns.
* Proactively share knowledge and insights across teams.
* Actively work to improve the overall developer experience.
* Assist management in tactical and strategic work.
* Host technical interviews to help grow the team with top talent.


**Who You Are**
 You are an experienced software developer with a deep understanding of custom-built applications and strong expertise in AWS, Java SpringBoot microservices, and system design patterns (scalability, resilience, security). You have a strategic mindset when it comes to software architecture and are proficient in DevOps practices like CI/CD. You're analytical, a problem solver, and comfortable managing complex projects, leading teams, and communicating effectively.
   

  

 Self-leadership, time management, and a proactive approach are key attributes of your working style. You lead by example, continuously learn, and are passionate about improving technical excellence within your team. You don't feel the need to be the most senior developer in the team but are comfortable working with and delegating to more senior technical experts, while contributing code alongside them.
   

  

**Our promise to you**
*We are better together.*
 Here, you'll be part of a family-like and inclusive culture, built on strong shared values and leadership that empowers you with both trust and confidence. We believe in enabling each other to act and make decisions, while always having each other's backs through ups and downs.
   

  

*We support relationships and societies.*
 Telenor plays a vital role in the society, giving your work a greater purpose. Every day, we create value for millions of people and maintain a customer-first approach where human relationships are at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

*We make room for life.*
 Work from home up to two days a week, where your role allows it. The rest of the time, we create magic together at the office. You also get two 'give-me-a-break' days per year for extra time off, and our flexible working hours help you balance your time. We also support you through every stage of life with our benefits package.
   

  

*We invite you to a career in motion.*
 Your development is at the center of our culture. We dedicate at least 40 hours per year for you to deepen your expertise, explore new areas, and develop in your role. Through Telenor Academy and other learning initiatives, you'll have the tools and freedom to advance your career. When you want to broaden your horizons, we are present throughout the Nordics.
   

  

**Apply today!**
 Will you take the next step in your career with us? We look forward to your application! We review applicants on an ongoing basis, so don't wait-reach out today.
   

  

 In this recruitment, Telenor collaborates with Experis IT, which has extensive experience in recruiting IT specialists and managers. If you have any questions or need more information, please contact Recruitment Consultants Anki Snis anki.snis@se.experis.com, +46 70-3775969 and Carina Eyoma at carina.eyoma@se.experis.com, +46 73-086 22 75.
   

  

 Selection is ongoing, so apply as soon as possible. We look forward to receive your application!
   

  

**Good to know**
 As part of Telenor's policy, we conduct background checks on final candidates for all recruitments.

title: Developer, Informatica
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Business Consulting and Services
description:
What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating a lot of opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.
   

  

 At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible, more innovative and successful. And this is your chance to be part of the success story: we are looking for an Informatica Data Management Cloud Administrator to join our team in Sweden.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Cognizant collaborates with all major hyperscale’s and relevant software vendors in the data and AI space. This includes partnerships with industry leaders such as AWS, Microsoft, Google, Snowflake, and Databricks. Our comprehensive approach ensures that we leverage the best tools and technologies to deliver scalable, secure, and efficient solutions. Additionally, we are supported locally by our dedicated Centres of Excellence, which operate both nearshore and offshore. These centres provide specialized expertise and resources, ensuring that we can meet the unique needs of our clients and drive innovation in AI and data cost effectively.
   

  

**About The Role**
 The Informatica Developer will work closely with data analysts, business analysts, and other IT professionals to create and maintain data solutions that ensure efficient and accurate data integration and management. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience with Informatica tools and a strong understanding of ETL processes.
   

  

**Your Key Result Areas**
* Design, develop, and maintain ETL/ELT workflows using Informatica IDMC tools
* Integrate data from various sources into cloud data warehouses (e.g., Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery)
* Configure and manage Secure Agents for job execution and monitoring
* Develop and deploy data quality rules and validation processes
* Implement data cataloging and metadata management for improved data discovery
* Build and consume REST/SOAP APIs for data exchange and automation
* Collaborate with data architects, analysts, and business users to understand data requirements
* Troubleshoot and optimize data pipelines for performance and reliability
* Ensure compliance with data governance and security policies
* Document technical designs, workflows, and best practices


**Requirements**
* Informatica IDMC Tools: Proficiency in Data Integration, Cloud Data Quality, and Cloud Application Integration
* ETL/ELT Development: Experience designing and building data pipelines and transformation logic
* Cloud Platforms: Familiarity Azure for cloud-native data workflows
* Secure Agent Configuration: Knowledge of deploying and managing Secure Agents
* Data Cataloging: Experience with metadata ingestion, data lineage, and classification
* API Integration: Working with REST/SOAP APIs for data exchange and automation
* Scripting Languages: Basic scripting in Python, Shell, or PowerShell for automation tasks
* SQL and Data Modeling: Strong SQL skills and understanding of relational and non-relational databases
* Version Control: Proficiency with Git for source code and workflow management
* Debugging and Optimization: Ability to troubleshoot data jobs and optimize performance

title: Backend Developer - Ruby
description:
**At Hemnet, Sweden’s #1 property portal, we’re continuing to grow and evolving our architecture to support more scalable and flexible solutions. That means keeping what works — like Ruby — while thoughtfully introducing new technologies where they add real value.** 
  

  

 We’re now strengthening our organization and are looking for developers who are confident working with Ruby and open to contributing to our journey towards a more balanced tech stack.
   

  

 This is a role for someone who enjoys solving real problems, wants to work in a modern development team, and takes pride in writing well-structured, maintainable code that delivers clear value.

* Contribute to the development of new features and the improvement of existing ones
* Collaborate closely with product managers, designers, and other developers to shape our products
* Take part in architectural and technical discussions and decisions

 We don’t expect you to know everything on day one — but we do expect you to be curious, open, and willing to grow alongside us.

 Ruby
   

  

* Node.js

**🏡 Your career at Hemnet** 
  

  

 With over 40 million visits each month, you’ll be part of Sweden’s most popular property platform – and one of the world’s most admired real estate platforms. But our size and reputation aren’t the only reasons why you and your 150+ colleagues enjoy working here.
   

  

 Since 1998, Hemnet has been an essential go-to place for millions of Swedes, guiding them through one of life’s biggest transitions: finding a new place to call home. We’re proud to make this life-changing, often stressful journey as seamless as possible.
   

  

 With access to vast amounts of data, you’ll have limitless opportunities to explore and create new features that enhance the experience for Sweden’s real estate agents, home buyers, and sellers.
   

  

 Our friendly Hemnet culture fosters a dynamic, playful environment where every voice is valued. Here, you’ll join a welcoming team that encourages you to thrive and grow, working alongside passionate colleagues from around the world.
   

  

**A Hybrid Way of Working** 
  

  

 Our vibrant office in central Stockholm is the hub of our collaboration and culture, providing a lively space that fosters team spirit. We come together in the office three days a week, with two flexible remote days. To be part of our team, it’s essential to be based in or near Stockholm.

description:
**Title:** 
**Product & Trims Developer – Jersey Garments Sports & RTW**
**Reports to** 
 :Hayley Ringguth

 :40
   

  

**Start Date:** 
 1st Aug
   

  

**Areas Of Responsibility**
* Lead the product development and negotiation process for jersey tops garments, for sportswear, RTW in menswear, and womenswear.
* Coordinate with the R&D manager on new trims for the season, entering in PLM, send out artwork to suppliers, check the samples against approved artwork and specifications, manage lab dips for each season, ensuring colour accuracy and approvals, and summarize leftover trims list.
* Collaborate with design, R&D, and suppliers to ensure high-quality, commercially successful products.
* Manage supplier relationships to guarantee timely delivery and product excellence.
* Stay updated on fashion trends, competitor activities, and technological advancements in garment production.
* Ensure data accuracy and updates in the PLM system for efficient workflow management.


**Objectives**
* Develop and execute innovative and commercially viable jersey garment collections.
* Ensure high standards in design, fit, and quality through meticulous prototyping and sampling.
* Ensure New Trims are accurately developed and on time.
* Maintain seamless communication between internal teams and external partners.
* Streamline product development processes to optimize efficiency and cost-effectiveness.
* Enhance brand competitiveness through strategic sourcing and trend-driven innovation.


**Working Tasks**
* Oversee the entire product development cycle from initial concept to SMS.
* Work closely with design teams to transform creative ideas into market-ready products.
* Coordinate with R&D to select appropriate fabrics, trims, and finishes.
* Conduct fittings and sample reviews to ensure product integrity and quality standards.
* Establish and nurture relationships with global suppliers.
* Monitor industry trends and implement innovative solutions for product improvement.
* Negotiate product and material costs inline with target margins.
* Maintain up-to-date records and data management within the PLM system.


**Internal Stakeholders**
* Design Team
* R&D
* Pattern Team
* Merchandising & Sales Teams
* Procurement Team
* Senior Management


**Qualifications**
* Minimum 3+ years of experience in product development for jersey garments, in either, sportswear, RTW, menswear, and womenswear and trims.
* Strong technical knowledge of garment construction, fabric properties, trims, and finishing techniques.
* Familiarity with PLM systems, preferably Centric PLM, is an advantage.
* Proven ability to manage supplier relationships and negotiate effectively.
* Strong organizational skills with a keen eye for detail and quality assurance.
* Ability to balance creativity with commercial viability in product development.
* Passion for fashion and a deep understanding of industry trends and consumer preferences.


 As part of a J.Lindeberg Team we are all from time to time involved in cross functional and collaborative projects of different character.
   

  

**J.Lindeberg Values**
 As part of J.Lindeberg you are an ambassador for J.Lindeberg and inspire our partners by living our Values
   

  

* Progressive - We strive to be at the forefront and we dare to challenge the status quo. It comes from our Scandinavian heritage – we are innovators within apparel, use of resources and way of working.
* Energetic-We are bringing energy into everything we do, we are entrepreneurial and agile. We are ready to do more and better each time. It makes our brand vibrant and magnetic.
* Inclusive - We are a people company. We are diverse and responsible. We act with integrity and take full accountability for what we do. We are a global community. We We care for the planet and each other.


 Founded in Stockholm 1996, J.Lindeberg inspires unconventional thinkers to live life to the fullest. The international fashion house bridges fashion and sport, offering sophisticated, edgy and comfortable products for a modern active lifestyle. The collections bring together creativity and Scandinavian progressiveness – for innovative fashion and outdoor lifestyle wear that is sustainable and delivered through a customer-focused, seamless experience.
   

  

 With headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden, the distribution covers more than 35 countries. There are 157 J.Lindeberg stores in several of the major fashion capitals of the world, such as Copenhagen, New York, Tokyo, Hong Kong and Shanghai. The wholesale distribution features close to 2000 stores, including the leading high-end department and specialty stores around the world.

title: Senior Staff Software Engineer
description:
At Optimizely, we're on a mission to help people unlock their digital potential. We do that by reinventing how marketing and product teams work to create and optimize digital experiences across all channels. With Optimizely One, our industry-first operating system for marketers, we offer teams flexibility and choice to build their stack their way with our fully SaaS, fully decoupled, and highly composable solution.
   

  

 We are proud to help more than 10,000 businesses, including H&M, PayPal, Zoom, and Toyota, enrich their customer lifetime value, increase revenue and grow their brands. Our innovation and excellence have earned us numerous recognitions as a leader by industry analysts such as Gartner, Forrester, and IDC, reinforcing our role as a trailblazer in MarTech.
   

  

 At our core, we believe work is about more than just numbers -- it's about the people. Our culture is dynamic and constantly evolving, shaped by every employee, their actions and their stories. With over 1500 Optimizers spread across 12 global locations, our diverse team embodies the "One Optimizely" spirit, emphasizing collaboration and continuous improvement, while fostering a culture where every voice is heard and valued.
   

  

**The Role:**
 We're seeking a skilled Software Engineer to join our Graph team and enhance the search functionality within our multi-tenant service. This role requires significant experience designing, implementing, and maintaining Elasticsearch/OpenSearch in a production environment. You will own projects from initial requirements gathering (PRD) through to successful completion, collaborating with customers to ensure solutions meet their specific needs.
   

  

 As part of our team, you'll contribute to building cutting-edge features leveraging serverless compute, auto-scaling OpenSearch clusters, and LLMs with Machine Learning nodes. We are a team that prioritizes high code quality in every commit.
   

  

**Why is this team critical to Optimizely?**
* Business Impact: Graph is the core content delivery and search service powering the SaaS version of our Content Management System (CMS). Our customers, who rely on Graph for their websites and mobile applications, demand high performance and advanced query capabilities to deliver exceptional user experiences. Graph's reliability and speed directly impact their business success.
* High Visibility & Innovation: Our roadmap prioritizes innovative content delivery and search features, placing search and AI at the forefront of our service offering. This focus differentiates us from competitors and empowers our customers to build cutting-edge web and mobile applications. You'll be instrumental in developing these differentiating features.
* Shape the Future of Digital Experiences: The team plays a critical role in shaping the future of our customers' digital presence. Your contributions will directly influence how they engage their audiences and achieve their business objectives through innovative search and content delivery experiences


**Experience Required:**
* 5+ years’ experience of developing and managing services in production
* Experience managing Elasticsearch / OpenSearch in production, with optimization of settings, shards, and replicas.
* Experience creating optimized Elasticsearch / OpenSearch queries
* Experience developing with TypeScript
* Expertise with API design and development of GraphQL or RESTful web services
* Partnering closely with internal stakeholders to gain a strong understanding of business and product data needs
* You find satisfaction in being a force multiplier for your colleagues
* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science or engineering or related experience require


**Some technologies we work with:**
* Elasticsearch / OpenSearch
* GraphQL, REST
* TypeScript, JavaScript, C#
* Cloudflare workers, Kubernetes


**What sets you apart:**
* Experience developing GraphQL APIs
* Experience in Kubernetes, Docker etc. and/ or serverless cloud stacks
* Experience developing multi-tenant services
* Experience of Machine Learning in Elasticsearch / OpenSearch
* Experience working with go-to-market teams
* Understanding the value of pair programming/TDD/Clean Code
* Exposure/Experience leveraging functional languages / paradigms


 Optimizely is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Optimizely is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
Mentimeter is an engagement tool with a clear goal in mind. To turn presentations into conversations. Through real-time interactivity and clear visualizations, we get people to participate, engage and become more productive. Transforming all those passive meetings, airless classrooms and drawn out trainings into valuable and memorable moments.
   

  

 We truly believe that you achieve the best results by doing things together. And that successful leaders need to adopt a curious and collaborative mindset in order to get there. So with you at Mentimeter, you’ll be a big part of the ambition to help over 1 billion people listen, learn and work better together.
   

  

**The Data Platform Team**
 The Data Platform Team at Mentimeter builds data infrastructure and services that influence the future path of the company. The team is part of the Catalyst organization and collaborates closely with the Data and Analytics organization which consists of other embedded and central teams of data scientists, analysts and insight people. Here, you’ll be working on a data ecosystem that serves all of the departments (Product, Marketing, Sales and Finance) with both data as well as infrastructure. You will have a direct impact on the future of Mentimeter’s business and product decisions.
   

  

 As a Senior Data Engineer, you will be involved in architecting and building data platforms to tackle business and technical use cases. We currently use AWS with technologies such as Snowflake, Prefect, dbt, Terraform, Postgres, ECS, Python, TypeScript, Hex and Looker. We are always exploring new technologies and you would also be part of the next leap in data platform maturity. Initially your team will consist of a Lead and two Data Engineers.
   

  

 Further enriching our vision is the emerging potential of Large Language Models (LLMs) and Generative AI. The synergy between LLMs and Mentimeter is a match made in the heavens. We anticipate lots of opportunities in which AI could profoundly influence the evolution of our product and our internal operations. In your capacity as a Senior Data Engineer, you would play a critical role in building the foundations that would fuel this future, with data.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Architect, integrate and maintain batch and stream data pipelines between operational and analytical databases as well as third party systems.
* Collaborate with product developers, analytics engineers and data scientists to deliver new data features within the data warehouse or other systems.
* Provide contextual and best-practice level contributions to the Data Engineering team from a technical standpoint and ensure proper and scalable architectural decisions and life cycle.
* Collaborate with analytics engineers to validate and ensure high data quality.
* Maintain a performant data warehouse.


**We Believe You Have**
* 5-8 years of previous experience working as a data engineer, data heavy backend developer or similar.
* Experience of software engineering and programming (Python, SQL, Java, Scala) in a professional environment.
* Experience building and maintaining a data platform in AWS.
* Proficient knowledge of architecture and design (patterns, reliability, scalability, quality) of systems.
* Ability to think strategically to assess priorities, possible solution alternatives and understand trade-offs before committing to a way forward.
* Experience with fast prototyping.
* Good communication and pedagogical skills.
* Comfortable communicating with a diverse set of technical and business stakeholders in English, especially written (daily work is carried out in English and the Mentimeter team currently boasts 50+ different nationalities).


**It Is Beneficial If You Have**
* Experience with Data warehouse systems in cloud environments such as AWS, GCP or Azure.
* Experience with Snowflake.
* Experience with GDPR compliance requirements around data in transit and data at rest.
* Experience with stream processing and real time systems.
* Experience with ML engineering.
* Professional experience working in an agile environment.
* Experience with attracting, finding and growing talented professionals


 Not sure you meet 100% of our qualifications? Please apply anyway and let us know why you would enjoy working in this role at Mentimeter!
   

  

 Please note that this role will have its base in our Stockholm office and is primarily an onsite role with the opportunity to work from home twice per week.
   

  

 Learn more about Our Ways of Working - Guiding Principles by clicking here.
   

  

 Please note: We’re on summer vacation and will review all applications and get back to you in August. Thanks for your patience and enjoy the summer!
   

  

**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page.
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Senior Rendering Software Engineer - C++
description:
**Description & Requirements**
 Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.
   

  

**Rendering Software Engineer - C++**
**We are Frostbite**
 Frostbite is EA’s proprietary game engine that comes equipped with tons of tools and technologies designed to build incredible games. Our in-house engine uniquely adapts to each game, while working hand-in-hand to prioritise what to build. Our goal is to empower creators all over the world to bring their best ideas to life by creating an engine that amplifies innovation across every discipline. Learn More
   

  

 Are you ready to push the boundaries of gaming technology? Join our dynamic
 **Frostbite Rendering team** 
 as a
 **S** 
**oftware Engineer!**
 You will work directly on the modern Render Hardware Abstraction Layer of the Frostbite engine; you will leverage the full power and features of supported APIs and hardware. Our team develops rendering backends for both current and future platforms and is distributed across North America and Europe. We collaborate with our "customers," the Rendering Engineers, to ensure performance and quality across all supported platforms. Reporting to the Engineering Manager, you'll play a vital role in advancing the rendering technology of the Frostbite Renderer, contributing to the success of some of the industry's biggest titles. We look forward to welcoming you to our team!
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 As a Software Engineer on the Rendering Backends team you will:
   

  

* Develop and maintain our low-level, cross-platform graphics hardware abstraction layer for the Frostbite Engine
* Lead performance profiling and optimizations on multiple platforms
* Collaborate with game team engineers and the Frostbite rendering team to deliver new rendering features
* Create and enhance tools that ensure quality experience for render engineers using Frostbite


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor's degree in computer science, Math or related field
* Advanced knowledge of C++ with at least 7 years of professional programming experience in real-time rendering
* Experience working in rendering for multiple shipped titles on current-generation consoles (PS5, XBSX, PC)
* Knowledge in one or more low-level graphics APIs (DX12, Vulkan, console, etc.)
* Familiarity of modern CPU/GPU hardware architectures
* Proficient with Graphics Debugging Tools (PIX, Renderdoc, console, etc.)
* Experience with memory management and multi-threading with related debugging and optimization experience


**Bonus**
* Professional experience working on Device Drivers.
* Professional experience developing graphics debugging tools / utilities / visualizers.
* Experience using source control systems (p4, git) in large code bases. #FlexibleWork


**Compensation And Benefits**
 The ranges listed below are what EA in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in these locations at the time of this posting. If you reside in a different location, a recruiter will advise on the applicable range and benefits. Pay offered will be determined based on a number of relevant business and candidate factors (e.g. education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, or business needs).
   

  

**PAY RANGES**
* British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria) \* $115,100 - $161,200 CAD


 In British Columbia, we offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity.
   

  

**About Electronic Arts**
 We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.
   

  

 We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.
   

  

 Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

title: ASIC Verification Engineer - UVM
description:
**Company Description**
 AFRY is a European leader in engineering, design, and advisory services, with a global reach. We accelerate the transition towards a sustainable society.
   

  

 We are 19,000 devoted experts in infrastructure, industry, energy and digitalisation, creating sustainable solutions for generations to come.
   

  

 Making Future.
   

  

**Job Description**
**Are you an ASIC-verification engineer with deep** 
***UVM-knowledge***
**looking for your next challenge?**
**Do you want to be part a flexible company with multiple opportunities?**
**Would you like to participate in exciting cutting-edge projects?**
 In that case we have the right position for you! We are currently expanding existing teams to contribute in bringing bright ideas and complex designs to life. Therefor we are looking for skilled ASIC-verification engineers
 *in UVM* 
 to join us and be part of successful a group. You will be involved in new and existing ASIC projects within telecom.
   

  

 Keywords: ASIC, Verilog, FPGA, Developer, Embedded Systems, Consulting, Consultant, Design System Architect, Verification, lab, SystemVerilog, UVM.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 In all our recruitments we attach great importance to personal qualities. If you can recognize yourself in our key values - BRAVE, DEVOTED, TEAM PLAYERS - maybe we're the employer you are looking for?
   

  

 We think that you have good cooperation skills and that you like to take responsibility!
   

  

 Preferably you already reside in Sweden, but for the right talent we offer a relocation package to move to Stockholm with your family.
   

  

 Knowledge and experience:
   

  

* You have a solid background with more than 3+ years of experience of ASIC verification
* Good command of UVM verification and SystemVerilog
* Used to work with complex ASIC and/or large FPGA design
* Experience from IP block verification
* Multi clock domains
* Good English skills, in both speech and writing


 Meritorious if you have:
   

  

* RTL design within Verilog, VHDL and/or SystemVerilog
* Leadership qualities
* Scripting skills
* Lab experience
* Telecommunication


**Additional Information**
* Permanent position
* 28 days annual leave
* Collective agreement
* Pension
* Competence development
* Health care allowance
* Access to Club AFRY & AFRY Cottages


**Contact information:**
**Maja Lindqvist**
 Recruitment Partner
   

  

 maja.lindqvist@afry.com
   

  

**Jihad Daoud**
 Section Manager
   

  

 jihad.daoud@afry.com
   

  

*At AFRY, we engineer change in everything we do. Change happens when brave ideas come together. When we collaborate, innovate technology, and embrace challenging points of view. That’s how we're making future. We are actively looking for qualified candidates to join our inclusive and diverse teams across the globe. Join us in accelerating the transition towards a sustainable future.*

title: React Native Utvecklare till B3 Mobile
description:
B3 Mobile är dotterbolaget inom koncernen som är
 ***experter***
 på apputveckling. iOS, Android, Cross-platform - Vi kan det!
   

  

 Vi söker dig som vill ta nästa steg i din karriär. Du kanske har arbetat med React Native utveckling i några år och känner dig redo för något nytt. Håll i hatten, för hos B3 Mobile arbetar vi med några av världens mest spännande kunder baserade både i Stockholm och på andra sidan Atlanten.
   

  

 I rollen som React Native utvecklare kommer du att arbeta tillsammans med ett kompetent och passionerat gäng utvecklare, UX-designers och projektledare både in-house och ute hos kund.
   

  

**Vi letar efter dig som:**
* Har en bakgrund som civilingenjör eller motsvarande
* Besitter goda kunskaper i Svenska, både i tal & skrift
* Har 3+ års erfarenhet som React Native utvecklare
* Kunskap om skillnader mellan standarder och API:er för iOS- och Android-plattformarna
* Erfarenhet av att sätta upp CI/CD pipelines för mobila applikationer
* Arbetar med fokus på slutanvändarnas upplevelse
* Levererar högkvalitativ kod som är ren och lätt att förstå och utöka
* Är proaktiv och kommer med förslag på lösningar inom de projekt du arbetar med


**Intresset ska självfallet vara ömsesidigt. Det här erbjuder vi dig:**
* Möjlighet att arbeta med tekniskt utmanande lösningar hos många olika kunder med ett stort antal användare.
* Flexibilitet & en hybrid modell där vi ses på kontoret en dag i veckan för att träffa kollegor, jobba tillsammans och lära oss nya saker.
* En snabbrörlig, rolig och trygg arbetsplats där vi strävar efter balans både i arbetslivet och livet i stort.
* Friskvårdsbidrag att lägga på gymkort, padel, massage eller andra aktiviteter.
* Wellness satsning för att säkerställa ditt välmående på arbetsplatsen.


 Vi jobbar mycket med kompetensutveckling, du kommer att vidareutvecklas och utforska de senaste teknikerna tillsammans med hela teamet. Du får ett stort ansvar och arbetar både individuellt och i större team. Vi tror att vår energi och nyfikenhet, vårt sätt att välkomna olikheter och vår vilja att dela med oss av våra erfarenheter bidrar till att skapa en miljö där alla, inklusive du, kan växa och utvecklas.
   

  

 För mer information kontakta VD Camilla Landén på camilla.landen@b3.se

title: Solutions Architect
description:
**Lösningsarkitekter till B3 Visab Consulting**
 Hos B3 Visab Consulting stödjer vi finansindustrins utveckling i den digitala ekonomin. Vi söker nu fler engagerade lösningsarkitekter som vill vara med och bidra till en samhällskritisk bransch.
